019package org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer;
020
021import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.DEPRECATED;
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
023
024import javax.lang.model.element.Modifier;
025import java.lang.reflect.Type;
026
027import org.apiguardian.api.API;
028import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
029import org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.internal.LambdaSpecImpl;
030
031/**
032 *  <p>{@summary The specification for a generated lambda construct.}</p>
033 *  <h2>Parameters and Types</h2>
034 *  <p>When adding more than one parameter, all of them must have a specified
035 *  type or none of them may have one, leaving the compiler to infer the type.
036 *  As
037 *  {@link JavaComposer#parameterBuilder(Type, CharSequence, Modifier...) paramterBuilder()}
038 *  does require a type, we take
039 *  {@link Primitives#VOID}
040 *  instead of a concrete type if we want to get the type being inferred.</p>
041 *  <h2>Formatting</h2>
042 *  <p>Basically, a lambda expression has two different formats, one without
043 *  curly braces</p>
044 *  <pre><code>  a -&gt; modify( a )</code></pre>
045 *  <p>and the other with with curly braces, requiring a return statement:</p>
046 *  <pre><code>  a -&gt;
047 *  {
048 *      modify( a );
049 *      return a.result;
050 *  }</code></pre>
051 *  <p>The body of the second form usually has more than one statement.</p>
052 *  <p>JavaComposer emits the first form when only one of the methods</p>
053 *  <ul>
054 *      <li>{@link LambdaSpec.Builder#addCode(String, Object...)}</li>
055 *      <li>{@link LambdaSpec.Builder#addCode(CodeBlock)}</li>
056 *  </ul>
057 *  <p>is called only once on the builder instance. The second form is forced,
058 *  when one of the methods above is called again, or when one of the
059 *  methods</p>
060 *  <ul>
061 *      <li>{@link LambdaSpec.Builder#addComment(String, Object...)}</li>
062 *      <li>{@link LambdaSpec.Builder#addStatement(CodeBlock)}</li>
063 *      <li>{@link LambdaSpec.Builder#addStatement(String, Object...)}</li>
064 *      <li>{@link LambdaSpec.Builder#beginControlFlow(String, Object...)}</li>
065 *      <li>{@link LambdaSpec.Builder#endControlFlow()}</li>
066 *      <li>{@link LambdaSpec.Builder#endControlFlow(String, Object...)}</li>
067 *      <li>{@link LambdaSpec.Builder#nextControlFlow(String, Object...)}</li>
068 *  </ul>
069 *  <p>is called.</p>
070 *  <p>There is no validation on the code; this means it is in the caller's
071 *  responsibility to ensure that there is a {@code return} statement in the
072 *  second case.</p>
073 *
074 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
075 *  @version $Id: LambdaSpec.java 1067 2023-09-28 21:09:15Z tquadrat $
076 *  @since 0.0.5
077 *
078 *  @UMLGraph.link
079 */
080@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: LambdaSpec.java 1067 2023-09-28 21:09:15Z tquadrat $" )
081@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
082public sealed interface LambdaSpec
083    permits LambdaSpecImpl
084{
085        /*---------------*\
086    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
087        \*---------------*/
088    /**
089     *  The builder for an instance of
090     *  {@link LambdaSpec}
091     *
092     *  @extauthor  Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
093     *  @version $Id: LambdaSpec.java 1067 2023-09-28 21:09:15Z tquadrat $
094     *  @since 0.0.5
095     *
096     *  @UMLGraph.link
097     */
098    @SuppressWarnings( "InnerClassOfInterface" )
099    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: LambdaSpec.java 1067 2023-09-28 21:09:15Z tquadrat $" )
100    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
101    public static sealed interface Builder
102        permits LambdaSpecImpl.BuilderImpl
103    {
104            /*---------*\
105        ====** Methods **======================================================
106            \*---------*/
107        /**
108         *  <p>{@summary Adds code for the lambda body.}</p>
109         *  <p>If only this method is called only once to add code to the
110         *  lambda body, the short, single line form for the lambda expression
111         *  will be emitted. That this will result in valid code requires that
112         *  the given code block has an appropriate contents.</p>
113         *
114         *  @param  codeBlock   The code.
115         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
116         */
117        public Builder addCode( final CodeBlock codeBlock );
118
119        /**
120         *  <p>{@summary Adds code for the lambda body.}</p>
121         *  <p>If only this method is called only once to add code to the
122         *  lambda body, the short, single line form for the lambda expression
123         *  will be emitted.</p>
124         *
125         *  @param  format  The format.
126         *  @param  args    The arguments.
127         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
128         */
129        public Builder addCode( final String format, final Object... args );
130
131        /**
132         *  <p>{@summary Adds a comment for the lambda body.}</p>
133         *  <p>A call to this method forces the multi-line emit format for the
134         *  lambda expression.</p>
135         *
136         *  @param  format  The format.
137         *  @param  args    The arguments.
138         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
139         */
140        public Builder addComment( final String format, final Object... args );
141
142        /**
143         *  <p>{@summary Adds a parameter for the lambda.}</p>
144         *  <p>The type of the parameter is inferred.</p>
145         *
146         *  @param  name    The name of the parameter.
147         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
148         */
149        public Builder addParameter( final String name );
150
151        /**
152         *  Adds a parameter for the lambda. Only type and name of the given
153         *  parameter are considered, annotations or modifiers will be ignored.
154         *
155         *  @param  parameterSpec   The parameter.
156         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
157         */
158        public Builder addParameter( final ParameterSpec parameterSpec );
159
160        /**
161         *  Adds a parameter for the lambda.
162         *
163         *  @param  type    The type of the parameter.
164         *  @param  name    The name of the parameter.
165         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
166         */
167        public Builder addParameter( final Type type, final String name );
168
169        /**
170         *  Adds a parameter for the lambda.
171         *
172         *  @param  type    The type of the parameter.
173         *  @param  name    The name of the parameter.
174         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
175         */
176        public Builder addParameter( final TypeName type, final String name );
177
178        /**
179         *  Adds parameters for the lambda. Only type and name of the given
180         *  parameters are considered, annotations or modifiers will be
181         *  ignored.
182         *
183         *  @param  parameterSpecs  The parameters.
184         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
185         */
186        public Builder addParameters( final Iterable<? extends ParameterSpec> parameterSpecs );
187
188        /**
189         *  <p>{@summary Adds a statement to the code for the lambda body.}</p>
190         *  <p>A call to this method forces the multi-line emit format for the
191         *  lambda expression.</p>
192         *
193         *  @param  statement   The statement.
194         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
195         */
196        public Builder addStatement( final CodeBlock statement );
197
198        /**
199         *  <p>{@summary Adds a statement to the code for the lambda body.}</p>
200         *  <p>A call to this method forces the multi-line emit format for the
201         *  lambda expression.</p>
202         *
203         *  @param  format  The format.
204         *  @param  args    The arguments.
205         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
206         */
207        public Builder addStatement( final String format, final Object... args );
208
209        /**
210         *  <p>{@summary Adds the begin of a control flow for the lambda
211         *  body.}</p>
212         *  <p>A call to this method forces the multi-line emit format for the
213         *  lambda expression.</p>
214         *
215         *  @param  controlFlow The control flow construct and its code, such
216         *      as &quot;{@code if (foo == 5)}&quot;; it should not contain
217         *      braces or newline characters.
218         *  @param  args    The arguments.
219         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
220         *
221         *  @see #endControlFlow()
222         *  @see #endControlFlow(String, Object...)
223         *  @see #nextControlFlow(String, Object...)
224         */
225        public Builder beginControlFlow( final String controlFlow, final Object... args );
226
227        /**
228         *  Creates a new
229         *  {@link LambdaSpec}
230         *  instance from the components that have been added to this builder.
231         *
232         *  @return The {@code MethodSpec} instance.
233         */
234        public LambdaSpec build();
235
236        /**
237         *  <p>{@summary Ends the current control flow for the lambda
238         *  body.}</p>
239         *  <p>A call to this method forces the multi-line emit format for the
240         *  lambda expression.</p>
241         *
242         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
243         *
244         *  @see #beginControlFlow(String, Object...)
245         *  @see #endControlFlow(String, Object...)
246         *  @see #nextControlFlow(String, Object...)
247         */
248        public Builder endControlFlow();
249
250        /**
251         *  <p>{@summary Ends the current control flow for the lambda body;
252         *  this version is only used for {@code do-while} constructs.}</p>
253         *  <p>A call to this method forces the multi-line emit format for the
254         *  lambda expression.</p>
255         *
256         *  @param  controlFlow The optional control flow construct and its
257         *      code, such as &quot;{@code while(foo == 20)}&quot;; it should
258         *      not contain braces or newline characters.
259         *  @param  args    The arguments.
260         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
261         *
262         *  @see #beginControlFlow(String, Object...)
263         *  @see #endControlFlow()
264         */
265        public Builder endControlFlow( final String controlFlow, final Object... args );
266
267        /**
268         *  <p>{@summary Begins another control flow for the lambda body.}</p>
269         *  <p>A call to this method forces the multi-line emit format for the
270         *  lambda expression.</p>
271         *
272         *  @param  controlFlow The control flow construct and its code, such
273         *      as &quot;{@code else if (foo == 10)}&quot;; it should not
274         *      contain braces or newline characters.
275         *  @param  args    The arguments.
276         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
277         *
278         *  @see #beginControlFlow(String, Object...)
279         *  @see #endControlFlow()
280         */
281        public Builder nextControlFlow( final String controlFlow, final Object... args );
282    }
283    //  interface Builder
284
285        /*---------*\
286    ====** Methods **==========================================================
287        \*---------*/
288    /**
289     *  Creates a builder for an instance of {@code LambdaSpec}.
290     *
291     *  @return The new builder.
292     *
293     *  @deprecated Replaced by
294     *      {@link JavaComposer#lambdaBuilder()}.
295     */
296    @SuppressWarnings( "removal" )
297    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
298    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
299    public static Builder builder() { return LambdaSpecImpl.builder(); }
300
301    /**
302     *  {@inheritDoc}
303     */
304    @Override
305    public boolean equals( final Object o );
306
307    /**
308     *  {@inheritDoc}
309     */
310    @Override
311    public int hashCode();
312
313    /**
314     *  Creates a new builder that is initialised with the components of this
315     *  lambda.
316     *
317     *  @return The new builder.
318     */
319    public Builder toBuilder();
320
321    /**
322     *  {@inheritDoc}
323     */
324    @Override
325    public String toString();
326}
327//  class LambdaSpec
328
329/*
330 *  End of File
331 */
